summary: Staying in business can be hard for dairy farmers if cattle feed prices go up or milk prices fall. But they can get help by signing up for a U.S. Department of Agriculture program that gives financial support in these circumstances. The program paid farmers about $2.7 billion from 2019 to 2024. The percentage of farmers who participated in each state varied, and most had...
title: Dairy Farmers: USDA Should Assess the Effectiveness of Its Communications Regarding Key Program Benefits
